SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.library

Class PathlingContext

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.library.PathlingContext
public class PathlingContext extends Object
A class designed to provide access to selected Pathling functionality from a language library context.
Author:
Piotr Szul, John Grimes

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    PathlingContext.Builder
    Builder for creating PathlingContext instances with configurable options.

  • Method Details

    • createInternal

      @Nonnull public static PathlingContext createInternal(@Nonnull SparkSession spark, @Nonnull au.csiro.pathling.encoders.FhirEncoders fhirEncoders, @Nonnull TerminologyServiceFactory terminologyServiceFactory)
      Creates a PathlingContext with advanced configuration for testing purposes. This method is internal and should not be used by library consumers but it needs to be public to be accessible from other packages in the module.
      Parameters:
      spark - the Spark session to use
      fhirEncoders - the FHIR encoders to use
      terminologyServiceFactory - the terminology service factory to use
      Returns:
      a new PathlingContext instance with default query configuration

    • builder

      @Nonnull public static PathlingContext.Builder builder()
      Creates a new PathlingContext.Builder for building a PathlingContext.
      Returns:
      a new builder instance

    • builder

      @Nonnull public static PathlingContext.Builder builder(@Nullable SparkSession spark)
      Creates a new PathlingContext.Builder for building a PathlingContext with a pre-configured Spark session.
      Parameters:
      spark - the Spark session to use, or null to use a default Spark session
      Returns:
      a new builder instance

    • getFhirContext

      @Nonnull public FhirContext getFhirContext()
      Gets the FhirContext for this instance.
      Returns:
      the FhirContext.

    • getEncodingConfiguration

      @Nonnull public EncodingConfiguration getEncodingConfiguration()
      Returns the encoding configuration used by this PathlingContext.

      The configuration is constructed on-demand from the current state of the FhirEncoders instance.

      Returns:
      the encoding configuration, never null

    • getTerminologyConfiguration

      @Nonnull public TerminologyConfiguration getTerminologyConfiguration()
      Returns the terminology configuration used by this PathlingContext.

      The configuration is retrieved from the terminology service factory. Factories that do not support configuration access will throw IllegalStateException.

      Returns:
      the terminology configuration, never null
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the terminology service factory does not support configuration access

    • create

      @Nonnull public static PathlingContext create()
      Creates a new PathlingContext with a default setup for Spark, FHIR encoders, and terminology services.
      Returns:
      a new PathlingContext instance

    • create

      @Nonnull public static PathlingContext create(@Nonnull SparkSession sparkSession)
      Creates a new PathlingContext using a pre-configured SparkSession.
      Parameters:
      sparkSession - the Spark session to use
      Returns:
      a new PathlingContext instance

    • createForEncoding

      @Nonnull public static PathlingContext createForEncoding(@Nonnull SparkSession sparkSession, @Nonnull EncodingConfiguration encodingConfig)
      Creates a new PathlingContext using supplied encoding configuration and a pre-configured SparkSession.

      This is a convenience method for case when only encoding functionality of Pathling is needed.

      Parameters:
      sparkSession - the Spark session to use
      encodingConfig - the encoding configuration to use
      Returns:
      a new PathlingContext instance

    • createForTerminology

      @Nonnull public static PathlingContext createForTerminology(@Nonnull SparkSession sparkSession, @Nonnull TerminologyConfiguration terminologyConfig)
      Creates a new PathlingContext using supplied configuration terminology and a pre-configured SparkSession.

      This is a convenience method for case when only terminology functionality (terminology UDFs) of Pathling is needed.

      Parameters:
      sparkSession - the Spark session to use
      terminologyConfig - the terminology configuration to use
      Returns:
      a new PathlingContext instance

    • encode

      @Nonnull public <T extends IBaseResource> Dataset<T> encode(@Nonnull Dataset<String> stringResources, @Nonnull Class<T> resourceClass, @Nonnull String inputMimeType)
      Takes a dataset with string representations of FHIR resources and encodes the resources of the given type as a Spark dataset.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Java type of the resource
      Parameters:
      stringResources - the dataset with the string representation of the resources.
      resourceClass - the class of the resources to encode.
      inputMimeType - the mime type of the encoding for the input strings.
      Returns:
      the dataset with Spark encoded resources.

    • encode

      @Nonnull public Dataset<Row> encode(@Nonnull Dataset<Row> stringResourcesDF, @Nonnull String resourceName, @Nonnull String inputMimeType, @Nullable String maybeColumnName)
      Takes a dataframe with string representations of FHIR resources and encodes the resources of the given type as a Spark dataframe.
      Parameters:
      stringResourcesDF - the dataframe with the string representation of the resources.
      resourceName - the name of the resources to encode.
      inputMimeType - the mime type of the encoding for the input strings.
      maybeColumnName - the name of the column in the input dataframe that contains the resource strings. If null the input dataframe must have a single column of type string.
      Returns:
      the dataframe with Spark encoded resources.

    • decode

      @Nonnull public <T extends IBaseResource> Dataset<String> decode(@Nonnull Dataset<Row> resources, @Nonnull String resourceName, @Nonnull String outputMimeType)
      Takes a dataframe of encoded resources of the specified type and decodes them into a dataset of string representations, based on the requested output MIME type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resource
      Parameters:
      resources - the dataframe of encoded resources
      resourceName - the name of the resources to decode
      outputMimeType - the MIME type of the output strings
      Returns:
      a dataset of string representations of the resources

    • encode

      @Nonnull public Dataset<Row> encode(@Nonnull Dataset<Row> stringResourcesDF, @Nonnull String resourceName, @Nonnull String inputMimeType)
      Takes a dataframe with string representations of FHIR resources and encodes the resources of the given type as a Spark dataframe.
      Parameters:
      stringResourcesDF - the dataframe with the string representation of the resources. The dataframe must have a single column of type string.
      resourceName - the name of the resources to encode.
      inputMimeType - the mime type of the encoding for the input strings.
      Returns:
      the dataframe with Spark encoded resources.

    • encode

      @Nonnull public Dataset<Row> encode(@Nonnull Dataset<Row> stringResourcesDF, @Nonnull String resourceName)
      Takes a dataframe with JSON representations of FHIR resources and encodes the resources of the given type as a Spark dataframe.
      Parameters:
      stringResourcesDF - the dataframe with the JSON representation of the resources. The dataframe must have a single column of type string.
      resourceName - the name of the resources to encode.
      Returns:
      the dataframe with Spark encoded resources.

    • encodeBundle

      @Nonnull public <T extends IBaseResource> Dataset<T> encodeBundle(@Nonnull Dataset<String> stringBundles, @Nonnull Class<T> resourceClass, @Nonnull String inputMimeType)
      Takes a dataset with string representations of FHIR bundles and encodes the resources of the given type as a Spark dataset.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Java type of the resource
      Parameters:
      stringBundles - the dataset with the string representation of the resources.
      resourceClass - the class of the resources to encode.
      inputMimeType - the mime type of the encoding for the input strings.
      Returns:
      the dataset with Spark encoded resources.

    • encodeBundle

      @Nonnull public Dataset<Row> encodeBundle(@Nonnull Dataset<Row> stringBundlesDF, @Nonnull String resourceName, @Nonnull String inputMimeType, @Nullable String maybeColumnName)
      Takes a dataframe with string representations of FHIR bundles and encodes the resources of the given type as a Spark dataframe.
      Parameters:
      stringBundlesDF - the dataframe with the string representation of the resources
      resourceName - the name of the resources to encode
      inputMimeType - the MIME type of the input strings
      maybeColumnName - the name of the column in the input dataframe that contains the bundle strings. If null, the input dataframe must have a single column of type string.
      Returns:
      a Spark dataframe containing the encoded resources

    • encodeBundle

      @Nonnull public Dataset<Row> encodeBundle(@Nonnull Dataset<Row> stringBundlesDF, @Nonnull String resourceName, @Nonnull String inputMimeType)
      Takes a dataframe with string representations of FHIR bundles and encodes the resources of the given type as a Spark dataframe.
      Parameters:
      stringBundlesDF - the dataframe with the string representation of the bundles. The dataframe must have a single column of type string.
      resourceName - the name of the resources to encode
      inputMimeType - the MIME type of the input strings
      Returns:
      a Spark dataframe containing the encoded resources

    • encodeBundle

      @Nonnull public Dataset<Row> encodeBundle(@Nonnull Dataset<Row> stringBundlesDF, @Nonnull String resourceName)
      Takes a dataframe with JSON representations of FHIR bundles and encodes the resources of the given type as a Spark dataframe.
      Parameters:
      stringBundlesDF - the dataframe with the JSON representation of the resources. The dataframe must have a single column of type string.
      resourceName - the name of the resources to encode
      Returns:
      a Spark dataframe containing the encoded resources

    • read

      @Nonnull public DataSourceBuilder read()
      Returns:
      a new DataSourceBuilder that can be used to read from a variety of different data sources

    • getVersion

      @Nonnull public String getVersion()
      Returns:
      the version of the Pathling library

    • isResourceTypeSupported

      public boolean isResourceTypeSupported(@Nonnull String resourceType)
      Checks if the given resource type is supported by the Pathling context.
      Parameters:
      resourceType - the resource type to check
      Returns:
      true if the resource type is supported, false otherwise

    • matchSupportedResourceType

      @Nonnull public Optional<String> matchSupportedResourceType(@Nonnull String resourceTypeString)
      Matches the given string against supported resource types in a case-insensitive fashion.
      Parameters:
      resourceTypeString - the string to match against resource types
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the resource type code if the string matches a supported resource type, empty otherwise
